Job role: Mechanical Designer for Space Products- Team Leader
Job Description: Job Description(FRENCH DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW)Mechanical Designer for Space Products– Team LeaderAs a mechanical designer of space products, you will be called upon to collaborate with a multidisciplinary engineering team to develop Photonics products for space applications. As part of one or more project teams, you will be responsible for establishing the concepts of our custom space products for international clients. From the submission phase to the detailed definition, you will define the mechanical assemblies to ensure that the final product meets the specific needs of the customer and can survive the conditions of a defined space environment. As a Team Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities related to its mechanical design in order to ensure the smooth progress of the project.Responsibilities Responsible for mechanical system design of space assemblies: Understand customer requirements.  Propose concepts that meet the requirements including cost targets and manufacturability.  Choose/design the components according to the constraints to be respected.  Integrate concepts from the disciplines of optical, electrical engineering, materials, structural and thermal analysis into a 3D model.  Supervision of mechanical design team to lead mechanical innovations and improvements of the space photonic products in order to accommodate various customer requirements for size, mass, and thermal heat management.  Responsible of overseeing mechanical tasks such as design, simulations, and space qualification test campaigns (TVAC, Vibration, Shock) within the mechanical design team on all space programs.  Overseeing and writing test reports for qualification test campaigns.  Assisting management in writing proposals, milestone presentations and reports.  Perform opto-mechanical design using Solidworks, thermal and vibration simulations using ANSYS.  Elaborate mass and volume budgets Perform radiation analysis and simulations using FASTRAD and OMERE software.  Follow up with mechanical suppliers about manufacturing issues. Qualifications Required Minimum Bachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field 5 year of experience in mechanical structure design and design analysis Strong analytical ability in structural analysis, static & dynamic analysis, frequency response analysis Experience with Solidworks software is must Experience with ANSYS for thermal and vibration analysis is must Knowledge of FASTRAD and OMERE Space or Aerospace experienceExperience with fiber optics is an asset Self starter with the ability to motivate othersAbility to work well within a team Excellent communication skills - both written and verbalConcepteur Mécanique de Produits Spatiaux– Chef d’ÉquipeÀ titre de concepteur mécanique de produits spatiaux, vous serez appelé à collaborer avec une équipe d'ingénierie multidisciplinaire pour développer des produits photoniques à application spatiale. Faisant partie d’une ou plusieurs équipes de projet, vous serez responsable de l’établissement des concepts de nos produits spatiaux personnalisés pour clients internationaux. De la phase de soumission jusqu’à la définition détaillée, vous définirez les composants des assemblages mécaniques afin de vous assurer que le produit final réponde aux besoins spécifiques du client et puisse survivre aux conditions environnementales définies par l’application spatiale. Comme chef d’équipe, vous serez également responsable de la coordination des activités reliées à la conception afin d’assurer une bonne progression du projet.ResponsabilitésResponsable de la conception de systèmes mécaniques d’amplificateurs spatiaux : Comprendre les exigences du client.  Proposer des concepts répondant aux exigences.  Choisir/concevoir les composantes en fonction des contraintes du projet.  Intégrer les concepts provenant des disciplines de plusieurs domaines tels que l’électronique, les matériaux, l’analyse structurelle et thermique dans un modèle 3D.  Supervision de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour diriger les innovations mécaniques et l’amélioration des amplificateurs à fibre spatiales afin de répondre aux diverses exigences des clients en matière de taille, de masse et de gestion thermique de la chaleur.  Responsable de la supervision des tâches mécaniques telles que la conception, les simulations et les campagnes d’essais de qualification spatiale (TVAC, Vibration, Choc, etc.) au sein de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour tous les programmes spatiaux. Superviser et rédiger des rapports de test pour les campagnes de tests de qualification. Aider la direction à rédiger des propositions, des présentations d’étape et des rapports.  Effectuer une conception opto-mécanique à l’aide de Solidworks ainsi que des simulations thermiques et structurelles à l’aide d’ANSYS.  Élaborer des budgets de masse et de volume.  Effectuer l’analyse de radiation via simulation en utilisant les logiciels FASTRAD et OMERE. Faire le suivi de la conformité et qualité des pièces mécaniques avec les fournisseurs.Qualifications minimales requises : Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe.  5 années d’expérience en conception de structures mécaniques et en analyse de conception.  Forte capacité en analyse structurelle, statique et dynamique ainsi qu’en analyse de réponse fréquentielle.  Expérience avec les logiciels Solidworks est indispensable.  Expérience avec ANSYS pour l’analyse thermique et structurelle est indispensable.  Connaissance de FASTRAD et OMERE.  Expérience en aérospatiale est un atout.  Expérience dans le domaine de la fibre optique est un atout.  Capacité à s’auto-motiver.  Bonne capacité à travailler en équipe.  Excellentes compétences en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. Job DescriptionWe are seeking a skilled CNC Millwork Programmer to join our team. As a CNC Millwork Programmer, you will be responsible for creating, optimizing, and maintaining CNC programs to produce high-quality millwork products. This role requires proficiency in CAD/CAM software, strong attention to detail, and the ability to interpret technical drawings accurately.Responsibilities:Program and operate CNC milling machines to produce millwork components according to technical drawings and specifications. Develop and optimize CNC programs using CAD/CAM software, ensuring efficient use of materials and minimizing waste. Collaborate with engineers and designers to review technical drawings, clarify specifications, and resolve any discrepancies. Set up CNC machines, including loading materials, selecting appropriate tools, and calibrating machine settings. Perform regular maintenance and troubleshooting on CNC equipment to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime. Conduct quality inspections of finished millwork components to verify compliance with design specifications and quality standards. Document CNC programs, tooling setups, and production processes for future reference and continuous improvement. Train and mentor junior CNC operators on programming techniques, machine operation, and safety protocols. Stay updated on industry trends, advancements in CNC technology, and best practices in millwork fabrication. Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Technology, or a related field (preferred). Proven experience as a CNC Millwork Programmer or similar role in a manufacturing environment. Proficiency in CAD/CAM software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Mastercam) for creating and editing CNC programs. Strong knowledge of CNC machining principles, including toolpath generation, feeds and speeds optimization, and G-code programming. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, blueprints, and schematics. Familiarity with woodworking materials, processes, and quality standards. Effective communication and teamwork skills. Commitment to safety and compliance with industry regulations. Willingness to work flexible hours as needed to meet production deadlines. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the production of high-quality millwork products using state-of-the-art CNC technology.Company DescriptionPeel HR is one of the fastest growing HR companies in the GTA. InspectorAs an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.TSSA regulates Fuel, Boiler Pressure Vessels, and Elevating Devices (escalators and elevators). Inspector positions are available in each of these three teams in regions across Ontario.Positions are available in:GTATimminsThunder BaySault Saint MarieBruce & Grey CountySouthwestern OntarioAbout Us:  Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the Ontario government. With headquarters in West Toronto, TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The TSSA is currently in the process of transitioning to an Outcome Based Regulator. We are in the process of updating our data systems, improving customer services, and improving our billing processes. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with various skill sets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals. All our employees share a few key traits:We are passionate about public safety.We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.We are committed to life-long learning and development.We operate with the highest integrity.TSSA provides our employees with a great sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the province, and it’s our people who make it possible.Position Summary: Inspectors are represented by the Ontario Public Service Employee Union - OPSEU/SEFPO, Local 546. As an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.We are looking for individuals with strong communication skills, who can present in a concise, clear, and articulate manner. You will need the ability to quickly adapt to change and realign with business priorities. You should have the disposition to follow scientific methods to determine root cause of incidents.Job Responsibilities:Enhance public safety by attending and inspecting scenes of incidents, public complaints relating to program inspection services to determine root causes.Identify appropriate action to prevent re-occurrence including issuance of legal orders.Ensure a positive image of the company and maintain effective relationships by providing timely information to customers (including interpretation/application of TSSA’s Act, Regulations, codes, and standards).Prepare and submit accurate reports within established timeframes; and maintain current electronic and paper records.Contribute to a workplace environment conducive to a high performing team by maintaining positive professional relationships with all members of the TSSA team; share expertise and best-practices; participate in the training and development of others; and provide back-up for colleagues.Demonstrate a commitment to health and safety by working in accordance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and TSSA health and safety procedures, and when on site, customers’ safety procedures, and by identifying and reporting potential and actual risks.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; and participating in professional associations. Job Qualifications:* (Specific qualifications for each team varies and please visit our website for more specific details)As this position requires daily travel, a valid Ontario driver’s license is required.Knowledge and application of Occupational Health and Safety ActIntermediate computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related elevating devicesSelf-starter manages the schedule and works collaboratively with supervisor and the scheduling team to prioritize workSpecific Fuels Inspector qualifications:5+ years experience in the hydrocarbon fuels industry and a thorough knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related Fuels Regulations 210/01, 212/01, 213/01, 215/01, 216/01 and 217/01.A Gas Technician level G2 or an Oil Burner Technician level OBT1/OBT2 is preferred.Liquid Propane (LP) and/or Petroleum Mechanic Certification (PMH/PM2/PH3) and/or Pipeline Inspector Certification (GPI) would be an asset.Knowledge of Codes and Standards and proficiency in the CSA B149.01 - Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code, CSA B149.02 - Propane Storage and Handling Code, CSA B149.03 - Code for the Field Approval of Fuel-Related components on Appliances and Equipment, Liquid Fuel Handling Code and the CSA Z662 - Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems. Specific BPV Inspector qualifications:Qualified to write the Ontario Certificate of Competency and will be able to obtain the National Board 'In-Service' and 'AI' Commission and ‘N’ EndorsementsFive years’ experience in the BPV industry is coupled with a comprehensive understanding of related CSA and ASME BPV codes, the Technical Standards and Safety Act, and BPV RegulationsSpecific Elevating Devices Inspector qualifications:Successful completion of a mechanical, electrical, engineering, or millwright certificationDemonstrated experience in mechanical, electrical, millwright, or engineering backgrounds.Practical field experience in the elevating industry.Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment:TSSA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building and maintaining collaborative, caring, and positive work environments so that our employees bring their whole selves to work each and every day. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status or disability. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  TSSA is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by us regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.  Please note that applicants who receive any conditional offer of employment from TSSA will be required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada as a condition of employment and to maintain their status as fully vaccinated as a condition of continued employment. TSSA will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to grounds protected under the Human Rights Code.

Acuva Technologies has developed breakthrough UV-LED water purification solutions for a variety of applications. Our proprietary UV-LED disinfection technology enables clean drinking water by offering a compact water purification solution, integrable with consumer appliances such as water coolers, water dispensers, refrigerators etc. We develop partnerships with OEM companies internationally to adopt cutting edge UV-LED water purification solution into their appliances.We are the recipients of the Greater Vancouver Board of Trade 2022 Business of Distinction Award for Business Growth, the MEET 2022 Innovation Award from the Canadian Institute of Plumbing & Heating (CIPH), the 2019 Global New Product Innovation Award by Frost & Sullivan, the BCIC Ignite Award by the BC Innovation Council, recognized as the Best Presenting Company for Sustainable Technology at the Banff Venture Forum and honoured to be added to the Cleantech Emerging Rocket list by Rocket Builders.Job Summary:Reporting to the VP of Engineering, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be responsible for the detail mechanical and system design of Acuva’s consumer and OEM air and water purification devices and identifying scalable technologies that will enable innovative design solutions at competitive cost and utmost reliability.He/she will collaborate with the R&D, engineering, and production teams as well as suppliers and contract manufacturers to ensure that the designs are aligned with product specifications, suitable for medium/large scale manufacturing and can be manufactured reliably.The Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will evaluate requirements, implement design ideas and analysis, and conduct standard practices such as DFMEA, DFA & DFM with the R&D/engineering teams, suppliers, CM’s and ODM’s. He/she will also be proficient in simulation tools for FEA and Moldflow, as a minimum the candidate must be able to interpret the results from simulations.The successful candidate will have demonstrated skills in consumer product design, sealing mechanism and custom manufacturing technologies such as injection molding, stamping, extrusion, casting and CNC as well as knowledge of part finishing processes for functional and cosmetic requirements.Self-motivated and driven to get results on time with a focus on repeatable quality, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be an effective communicator with excellent oral and written communication skills (English), and able to make simple accurate recommendations when confronted with complex time-sensitive situations.What you will be doing:With the R&D team conceptualize and create mechanical designs for feasibilityWorking closely with Supply Chain, validate tooling DFM, Tool costs and part costs for custom designed mechanical partsDevelop detail mechanical and system designs of OEM and consumer water disinfection appliancesReview product designs for risk and provide risk mitigation plans for the implementation of New, Unique, Different or Difficult (NUDD’s)Clearly report and recommend design improvements based on theoretical analysis and discussions with suppliers, engineering, and operations teamManage PDM part management systems and Engineering Change Request processesDefine protocols and criteria for validation of mechanical parts and productsRoot cause analysis for device failures and propose design/process corrective actionsTechnical interface between Acuva and vendor partners for new product development and introductionConceptualize and design product test jigs to streamline mass volume production of an optomechanical product lineWorking with the design responsible scientists, engineers, & quality personnel to maintain smooth design process and product function/reliabilityVisit Acuva’s vendors locally or overseas to setup, improve and verify proper production practices are followed (must be able to travel internationally)Additional duties as required to assist with day-to-day coordination of R&D and engineering team activitiesSkills you will need:Practical mechanical hands-on design, computer analysis, prototyping, knowledge of machining, forming, welding, and joining techniques for mechanical devicesSkilled in mechanical part selection from off-the-shelf vendors (eg. O-rings, seal materials, adhesives, gaskets, and fasteners)Creative and efficient mechanical design and solid modeling skillsFast and accurate print drawing and BOM creation skills with knowledge of tolerancing and drawing conventionsDesign for manufacturing expertise and supporting tools FMEA, concept selection, design of experimentKnowledge of tooling principles and the ability to manage and negotiate tooling schedules and deliverablesWhat we are looking for:Minimum 10+ years of experience in product design, sealing technologies, and manufacturing support rolesStrong hands-on experience in design, design analysis and manufacturing technologies implementationMust be comfortable working in an entrepreneurial-spirited, fast-paced and constantly changing environment with a desire to make a strong impact on the businessBackground in a start-up, fast-paced, high-technology design and manufacturing environmentMinimum Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering from an established and accredited post-secondary institutionIt would be great if you had:Knowledge of designing for injection molded fabrication processKnowledge of sealing mechanism, pressure vessel design, high pressure sealing technologiesExperience working in high volume OEM and consumer product design and manufacturing in IndiaExperience in Lean, Six Sigma, or KaizenWhat We Offer:Competitive Salary with Extended Health and Dental benefitsPerformance Bonus Program and Stock OptionsInclusive and Collaborative work environmentEmployee Recognition ProgramTeam Building EventsAnd so much more!Acuva is diverse and inclusive. We are seeking a skilled General Machinist to join our client's team in Brampton, ON location.Shift - DayResponsibilitiesSet up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts according to engineering drawings and specifications. Utilize manual and computer-controlled machinery, such as lathes, milling machines, drill presses, and grinders, to perform machining operations. Measure and inspect machined parts using precision measuring instruments, ensuring compliance with dimensional tolerances and quality standards. Interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, and work instructions to determine machining processes, tooling requirements, and sequence of operations. Select appropriate cutting tools, speeds, and feeds for each machining operation, optimizing efficiency and ensuring the quality of finished parts. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to machine setup, tooling, and machining processes to maintain productivity and quality standards. Perform routine maintenance tasks on machinery, such as cleaning, lubricating, and replacing worn components, to ensure optimal performance and longevity. Adhere to safety protocols and practices to minimize workplace hazards and promote a safe working environment. Collaborate with engineering, production, and quality assurance teams to optimize manufacturing processes and resolve technical challenges. Continuously strive to improve machining techniques, processes, and efficiencies through innovation and continuous learning. QualificationsMinimum of a high school diploma and Ontario Machinist Certification. At least 5 years of experience in machine shop and fabrication, particularly in producing thermoforming molds or similar applications. Proficiency in various tooling machinery usage, including Milling Machines, Lathes, Drilling Machine, Band saws, Grinders, etc. Ability to verify dimensions of machined parts or tooling using different measuring instruments such as Vernier Calipers, Micrometers, Height gauges, etc. Strong ability to read and interpret blueprints or examine sample parts to determine machining operations required.

Requisition ID: 170971Job Level: ExecutiveHome District/Group: Ganotec DistrictDepartment: Field OperationsMarket: IndustrialEmployment Type: Full TimePosition OverviewGanotec is looking for an Area Manager that will be responsible for project development, people development, estimates, and project sponsorship for EPC projects. The Area Manager will develop and maintain trusting relationships with key client decision makers. The candidate will need to be able to lead a team to develop accurate EPC estimates with appropriate risk analysis and winning execution strategies.The Area Manager will be responsible for projects take-offs once awarded and provide oversight and direction for the project team regarding safety, quality, project controls, financials, and client relationship partnering to assure a successful project. Candidate will need the capacity to manage several estimates and projects simultaneously in the $100M to $1B size range or single $1B+ estimates and projects.The Area Manager is always the first level of off-site management on a project. He meets with project management teams regularly to review progress and ensure they have all necessary resources to be successful. The Area Manager provides experienced leadership, supervision and construction expertise to project teams and leads other senior and junior personnel in estimating, planning, engineering, and contract fulfillment. He or she also frequently works with client representatives and executives to communicate progress and resolve any issues needing attention.District OverviewGanotec is a full service, heavy industrial contractor serving the industrial sector across Canada. Ganotec typically self performs all major disciplines including, civil, structural steel erection, heavy mechanical equipment installation, process piping and electrical / instrumentation and controls. We conduct our business through a variety of commercial contract styles including full turnkey, EPC, design build, T&M and conventional discipline packages. We have always been a strong proponent of “partnering”, working in collaboration with owners, major equipment suppliers and engineers at the early stages of the project development phase to allow for a more cost-effective execution strategy for the project. Ganotec continues to position ourselves towards the future, constantly seeking growth opportunities yet never losing sight of what has made the company so successful.LocationThis position will have home location based in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). Oakville ONResponsibilitiesThe Area Manager has overall accountability for projects throughout the GTA. As the Area Manager you will act as the representative of the organization, and play a vital leadership role through: Provide Operations 'championship' for the projects throughout the Ontario region. Provide business expertise and guidance to the Project Manager(s). Act as the liaison between the project owners, the business community and key management decision making groups. Act as an arbitrator and making decisions that may be beyond the authority of the Project Manager. Ensure that the business need is valid, correctly prioritized and project is properly launched. Ensure that the projects remains a viable business proposition. Ensure changes to the projects are properly managed and risks are assessed. Establish the project organization, roles and reporting structure. Ensure the project is following all Safety Guidelines and policies. Approve key project deliverables. Initiate project reviews and audits and supporting the process of review with project team. Identify, assess, and inform the District of internal and external risks and issues that affect the business. Use logic, data and experience to recognize conflicts and facilitate solutions. Understand and prioritize the overall quality and safety of the project, the methods used to develop it and the end product. Work closely with ``Get Work`` and ``Build Work`` teams and other internal departments ensuring maximum exposure of the Company’s capabilities, including an understanding of the offerings of other Kiewit business units and the presentation of those capabilities when appropriate. Communicate effectively with all stakeholders including the client, vendors, and subcontractors. Drive business growth through expanding service offerings within existing clients. Present ideas in a persuasive and compelling way; gains support and buy-in without demanding it; influence others to the desired course of action. Collaborate actively with the Business Line Manager of business planning and market strategy. Champion innovation and continuous improvement; drive efficiency and productivity and seek ways to improve customer satisfaction and employee engagement. Identify, evaluate, and mitigate operating risks inherent in the business that could materially impact the company’s reputation and/or operating results. Build strong relationship with other Operational Leaders of the District and foster effective teamwork between leadership and staff. Develop our people and provide mentorship to future builders by sharing knowledge, experiences and knowing the company’s learning and developmental resources.Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in engineering, construction management or business preferred. 15+ years of relevant experience in construction or engineering leadership to the mechanical and/or electrical construction market. Experience in contract negotiation in a union industrial construction market for engineering, construction and EPC project work. Experience preferred in Industrial/Electrical/Mechanical construction operations and/or operations management. Able to rapidly develop strategies and tactical plans to position Ganotec in these markets. Innovative and have the ability to perceive business opportunities and work closely with company management in developing and executing strategies which capitalize on these opportunities. Possess a professional demeanor that builds trusting relationships. Strong client negotiation skills. Highly motivated, with a demonstrated passion for excellence in taking initiative. Demonstrated commitment to ethics and integrity. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. French is considered an asset. Interact effectively both professionally and socially with people of all levels. Aggressive about career advancement through results-based performance. Conduct himself/herself in a manner which will reflect favorably upon the company, enhance its reputation and promote good will. Maintain a reputation for integrity, maturity, and sound business judgment. Up to 50% travel required.Other Requirements: Regular, reliable attendance Work productively and meet deadlines timely Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with supervisors, employees, and others individually or in a team environment Perform work safely and effectively. Understand and follow oral and written instructions, including warning signs, equipment use, and other policies. Work during normal operating hours to organize and complete work within given deadlines. Work overtime and weekends as required. FIELD ROLES ONLY May work at various different locations and conditions may varyWe offer our fulltime staff employees a comprehensive benefits package that’s among the best in our industry, including top-tier medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, voluntary wellness and employee assistance programs, life insurance, disability, retirement plans with matching, and generous paid time off.We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

An opportunity for a Project Manager/ Estimator to join an established family run contractor in the Lower Mainland! Your new company:Looking to join a widely known and respected, family-owned Mechanical Contractor with over 70 years’ of experience in the industry? Our client is known for providing custom mechanical solutions for institutional & commercial projects across Vancouver and the Lower Mainland. With a long-standing reputation in the area, this client has a secure and long-standing client base and is currently working on multiple large-scale projects. Now on a growth trajectory, our client is ready to bring in a new team member to help them achieve their future goals. Your new role:We are looking for an individual who will be joining this well-established team as a Project Manager/ Estimator (Or Project Coordinator who is looking to become PM). If successful, you will be responsible for ensuring the success of your assigned project(s), including the planning, management, and execution of projects. Day-to-day tasks include but are not limited to, communicating project expectations and goals to other team members, enforcing a site-specific health and safety plan, enforcing schedule deadlines throughout the project, submitting quotations, being responsible for coordination of site drawings, monitoring job costing, and prepare reports for review and other duties as required. You will also be expected to do some estimating. What you’ll need to succeed:To succeed as the Mechanical Project Manager/ Estimator, you will bring 3 - 5+ years in the mechanical construction industry and be eager to learn and grow in the role and with the organization. You will need to be familiar with Mechanical Contracting and associated components, be detail-oriented, and be someone who can work independently, though also work well in a team. You will be approachable and professional with customers, proficient in Microsoft Office products, and ideally have experience with estimating. What you’ll get in return:As the Project Manager, you will receive a competitive base salary ($70,000 - $100,000) dependent on experience) 3 weeks’ vacation (excluding Christmas), an extensive benefits plan from day one, and opportunities for professional development. You will be joining a close-knit team that values work-life balance and family, but also works hard to maintain its reputation are excited to find someone who can join the team to help them grow. What you need to do now:If this opportunity in the mechanical industry sounds like it could be the right next step within your career, apply now. Your Hays consultant is looking forward to connecting with those who meet the above qualifications to discuss the next steps. Please note all applications are highly confidential.

One of our automotive clients in Newmarket, ON is looking for  Controls Engineer for their facility.Shift - NightDuties And ResponsibilitiesDesign and execute control systems for industrial equipment using PLC technology. Configure PLC hardware and programs, including ladder, structured text, and function blocks. Contribute to the development of equipment motor and device lists. Job DescriptionDo Something Wonderful! Intel put the Silicon in Silicon Valley. No one else is this obsessed with engineering a brighter future. Join us, because at Intel, we are building a better tomorrow. Want to learn more? Visit our YouTube Channel or the links below!Life at Intel Diversity at Intel Intel desires entry into market segments served by high performance discrete graphics. Participation in such market segments requires the delivery of reference platforms to downstream customers with sufficient confidence to ramp the design, or a very close derivative, into high volume production quickly. Intel is building this capability and now seeks to expand its discrete graphics Platform Engineering team. Are you interested? Then XPE has an opportunity for you. In XPE, we are responsible for delivering leading GPU solutions for integrated and discrete graphics across market segments, and will continue to deliver a pipeline of innovation, to support the complete Intel platform, including CPU, memory, and accelerators.As a Mechanical Design Engineer your responsibilities will include but notLimited ToDrives end to end graphics platform hardware development and design and translates platforml evel requirements to specifications.Designs, develops, modifies, and evaluates electronic parts, components, PCB, or integrated circuitry for GPU from feasibility studies to board tapeout, meeting multidisciplinary platform level requirements.Verifies functionality by leading platform powerons, running comprehensive functionality tests, and utilizing tools to confirm platform configurations are set as expected.Drives design research and verification, development, testing, and utilization of firmware, hardware, components, mechanisms, materials, circuitry processes, packaging, and chassis for GPU platforms including discrete graphics components.Applies deep understanding of feature design and validation, utilizes this knowledge to confirm system compatibility or troubleshoot customer concerns, defines processes for technical platforms, system specifications, input/output, and working parameters for hardware and software compatibility.Drives innovation in high performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies through understanding and driving flows and processes for testing, manufacturing, and debug features of GPUs.Collaborates with platform teams (e.g., architecture, power, power integrity, signal integrity, thermal, mechanical, firmware) to develop highquality GPU systems based on performance needs and industry standards (e.g., PCIe, OAM), recommends optimal place and route, and resolves system development and bringup issues to deliver the best quality for platform.QualificationsWhat we need to see (Minimum Qualifications):Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field with 3+ years relevant experience or a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 2+ years of relevant experience.1+ years of experience designing mechanical solutions utilizing 3D modelling software such as Creo or SolidWorks.1+ years of working with mechanical simulation software such as Abaqus or Ansys.1+ years of experience with thermal mechanical testing/debug/analysis.How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical high performance thermal mechanical solutions for electronics applications (air cooled and/or liquid cooled), such as semiconductor, package, PCB and system design.4+ years of experience understanding the tradeoffs between mechanical, thermal and electrical criteria.4+ years of experience with mechanical part manufacturing processes and surface finish options.3+ years of experience with mechanical fundamentals in the PC eco-system.2+ years of experience working with PCIe, OAM or other desktop or server form factors.1+ years of experience with thermal simulation such as Icepak or Flotherm.Inside this Business GroupThe Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Job Description: Job Description(FRENCH DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW)Mechanical Designer for Space Products– Team LeaderAs a mechanical designer of space products, you will be called upon to collaborate with a multidisciplinary engineering team to develop Photonics products for space applications. As part of one or more project teams, you will be responsible for establishing the concepts of our custom space products for international clients. From the submission phase to the detailed definition, you will define the mechanical assemblies to ensure that the final product meets the specific needs of the customer and can survive the conditions of a defined space environment. As a Team Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities related to its mechanical design in order to ensure the smooth progress of the project.Responsibilities Responsible for mechanical system design of space assemblies: Understand customer requirements.  Propose concepts that meet the requirements including cost targets and manufacturability.  Choose/design the components according to the constraints to be respected.  Integrate concepts from the disciplines of optical, electrical engineering, materials, structural and thermal analysis into a 3D model.  Supervision of mechanical design team to lead mechanical innovations and improvements of the space photonic products in order to accommodate various customer requirements for size, mass, and thermal heat management.  Responsible of overseeing mechanical tasks such as design, simulations, and space qualification test campaigns (TVAC, Vibration, Shock) within the mechanical design team on all space programs.  Overseeing and writing test reports for qualification test campaigns.  Assisting management in writing proposals, milestone presentations and reports.  Perform opto-mechanical design using Solidworks, thermal and vibration simulations using ANSYS.  Elaborate mass and volume budgets Perform radiation analysis and simulations using FASTRAD and OMERE software.  Follow up with mechanical suppliers about manufacturing issues. Qualifications Required Minimum Bachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field 5 year of experience in mechanical structure design and design analysis Strong analytical ability in structural analysis, static & dynamic analysis, frequency response analysis Experience with Solidworks software is must Experience with ANSYS for thermal and vibration analysis is must Knowledge of FASTRAD and OMERE Space or Aerospace experienceExperience with fiber optics is an asset Self starter with the ability to motivate othersAbility to work well within a team Excellent communication skills - both written and verbalConcepteur Mécanique de Produits Spatiaux– Chef d’ÉquipeÀ titre de concepteur mécanique de produits spatiaux, vous serez appelé à collaborer avec une équipe d'ingénierie multidisciplinaire pour développer des produits photoniques à application spatiale. Faisant partie d’une ou plusieurs équipes de projet, vous serez responsable de l’établissement des concepts de nos produits spatiaux personnalisés pour clients internationaux. De la phase de soumission jusqu’à la définition détaillée, vous définirez les composants des assemblages mécaniques afin de vous assurer que le produit final réponde aux besoins spécifiques du client et puisse survivre aux conditions environnementales définies par l’application spatiale. Comme chef d’équipe, vous serez également responsable de la coordination des activités reliées à la conception afin d’assurer une bonne progression du projet.ResponsabilitésResponsable de la conception de systèmes mécaniques d’amplificateurs spatiaux : Comprendre les exigences du client.  Proposer des concepts répondant aux exigences.  Choisir/concevoir les composantes en fonction des contraintes du projet.  Intégrer les concepts provenant des disciplines de plusieurs domaines tels que l’électronique, les matériaux, l’analyse structurelle et thermique dans un modèle 3D.  Supervision de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour diriger les innovations mécaniques et l’amélioration des amplificateurs à fibre spatiales afin de répondre aux diverses exigences des clients en matière de taille, de masse et de gestion thermique de la chaleur.  Responsable de la supervision des tâches mécaniques telles que la conception, les simulations et les campagnes d’essais de qualification spatiale (TVAC, Vibration, Choc, etc.) au sein de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour tous les programmes spatiaux. Superviser et rédiger des rapports de test pour les campagnes de tests de qualification. Aider la direction à rédiger des propositions, des présentations d’étape et des rapports.  Effectuer une conception opto-mécanique à l’aide de Solidworks ainsi que des simulations thermiques et structurelles à l’aide d’ANSYS.  Élaborer des budgets de masse et de volume.  Effectuer l’analyse de radiation via simulation en utilisant les logiciels FASTRAD et OMERE. Faire le suivi de la conformité et qualité des pièces mécaniques avec les fournisseurs.Qualifications minimales requises : Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe.  5 années d’expérience en conception de structures mécaniques et en analyse de conception.  Forte capacité en analyse structurelle, statique et dynamique ainsi qu’en analyse de réponse fréquentielle.  Expérience avec les logiciels Solidworks est indispensable.  Expérience avec ANSYS pour l’analyse thermique et structurelle est indispensable.  Connaissance de FASTRAD et OMERE.  Expérience en aérospatiale est un atout.  Expérience dans le domaine de la fibre optique est un atout.  Capacité à s’auto-motiver.  Bonne capacité à travailler en équipe.  Excellentes compétences en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. InspectorAs an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.TSSA regulates Fuel, Boiler Pressure Vessels, and Elevating Devices (escalators and elevators). Inspector positions are available in each of these three teams in regions across Ontario.Positions are available in:GTATimminsThunder BaySault Saint MarieBruce & Grey CountySouthwestern OntarioAbout Us:  Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the Ontario government. With headquarters in West Toronto, TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The TSSA is currently in the process of transitioning to an Outcome Based Regulator. We are in the process of updating our data systems, improving customer services, and improving our billing processes. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with various skill sets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals. All our employees share a few key traits:We are passionate about public safety.We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.We are committed to life-long learning and development.We operate with the highest integrity.TSSA provides our employees with a great sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the province, and it’s our people who make it possible.Position Summary: Inspectors are represented by the Ontario Public Service Employee Union - OPSEU/SEFPO, Local 546. As an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.We are looking for individuals with strong communication skills, who can present in a concise, clear, and articulate manner. You will need the ability to quickly adapt to change and realign with business priorities. IEM Canada (Industrial Electric Manufacturing, Inc.) in Surrey, BC, is the largest independent full-line manufacturer of custom electrical distribution and power quality equipment in North America. IEM has delivered customer-specific solutions to meet the ever-changing power requirements of growth industries in North America for over half a century. This position offers an exciting opportunity within an innovative, employee-oriented company!Reporting to Engineering Manager, The Engineering Assistant provides crucial support to the local engineering team and Engineering Manager. The Engineering Assistant plays a vital role in ensuring efficient communication, documentation, and coordination within the engineering department. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS • Provide CAD support for the engineering team on an as-needed basis. • Work with IEM systems to create bill of materials when needed. • Act as an interface between production and the engineering team. • Work with production leads to bring issues to engineering. • Provide regular updates to the engineering team on equipment production status. • Generate reports at routine intervals for upcoming commitment dates, milestones, etc. • Provide onboarding support for new engineers. • Review for accuracy and processing of Engineering Transmittals. COMPETENCIES • Must have experience with 2D CAD software (AutoCAD Preferred) • Team player with an adaptive skillset • Excellent written and oral communications skills • Pride in Workmanship • Excellent time management and organization skills • Attention to detail and thoroughness EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE • Technical institute certificate or equivalent professional experience preferred. • Working knowledge of AutoCAD drafting software • Excellent working knowledge of MS Office Suites (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, etc.)

Acuva Technologies has developed breakthrough UV-LED water purification solutions for a variety of applications. Our proprietary UV-LED disinfection technology enables clean drinking water by offering a compact water purification solution, integrable with consumer appliances such as water coolers, water dispensers, refrigerators etc. We develop partnerships with OEM companies internationally to adopt cutting edge UV-LED water purification solution into their appliances.We are the recipients of the Greater Vancouver Board of Trade 2022 Business of Distinction Award for Business Growth, the MEET 2022 Innovation Award from the Canadian Institute of Plumbing & Heating (CIPH), the 2019 Global New Product Innovation Award by Frost & Sullivan, the BCIC Ignite Award by the BC Innovation Council, recognized as the Best Presenting Company for Sustainable Technology at the Banff Venture Forum and honoured to be added to the Cleantech Emerging Rocket list by Rocket Builders.Job Summary:Reporting to the VP of Engineering, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be responsible for the detail mechanical and system design of Acuva’s consumer and OEM air and water purification devices and identifying scalable technologies that will enable innovative design solutions at competitive cost and utmost reliability.He/she will collaborate with the R&D, engineering, and production teams as well as suppliers and contract manufacturers to ensure that the designs are aligned with product specifications, suitable for medium/large scale manufacturing and can be manufactured reliably.The Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will evaluate requirements, implement design ideas and analysis, and conduct standard practices such as DFMEA, DFA & DFM with the R&D/engineering teams, suppliers, CM’s and ODM’s. He/she will also be proficient in simulation tools for FEA and Moldflow, as a minimum the candidate must be able to interpret the results from simulations.The successful candidate will have demonstrated skills in consumer product design, sealing mechanism and custom manufacturing technologies such as injection molding, stamping, extrusion, casting and CNC as well as knowledge of part finishing processes for functional and cosmetic requirements.Self-motivated and driven to get results on time with a focus on repeatable quality, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be an effective communicator with excellent oral and written communication skills (English), and able to make simple accurate recommendations when confronted with complex time-sensitive situations.What you will be doing:With the R&D team conceptualize and create mechanical designs for feasibilityWorking closely with Supply Chain, validate tooling DFM, Tool costs and part costs for custom designed mechanical partsDevelop detail mechanical and system designs of OEM and consumer water disinfection appliancesReview product designs for risk and provide risk mitigation plans for the implementation of New, Unique, Different or Difficult (NUDD’s)Clearly report and recommend design improvements based on theoretical analysis and discussions with suppliers, engineering, and operations teamManage PDM part management systems and Engineering Change Request processesDefine protocols and criteria for validation of mechanical parts and productsRoot cause analysis for device failures and propose design/process corrective actionsTechnical interface between Acuva and vendor partners for new product development and introductionConceptualize and design product test jigs to streamline mass volume production of an optomechanical product lineWorking with the design responsible scientists, engineers, & quality personnel to maintain smooth design process and product function/reliabilityVisit Acuva’s vendors locally or overseas to setup, improve and verify proper production practices are followed (must be able to travel internationally)Additional duties as required to assist with day-to-day coordination of R&D and engineering team activitiesSkills you will need:Practical mechanical hands-on design, computer analysis, prototyping, knowledge of machining, forming, welding, and joining techniques for mechanical devicesSkilled in mechanical part selection from off-the-shelf vendors (eg. O-rings, seal materials, adhesives, gaskets, and fasteners)Creative and efficient mechanical design and solid modeling skillsFast and accurate print drawing and BOM creation skills with knowledge of tolerancing and drawing conventionsDesign for manufacturing expertise and supporting tools FMEA, concept selection, design of experimentKnowledge of tooling principles and the ability to manage and negotiate tooling schedules and deliverablesWhat we are looking for:Minimum 10+ years of experience in product design, sealing technologies, and manufacturing support rolesStrong hands-on experience in design, design analysis and manufacturing technologies implementationMust be comfortable working in an entrepreneurial-spirited, fast-paced and constantly changing environment with a desire to make a strong impact on the businessBackground in a start-up, fast-paced, high-technology design and manufacturing environmentMinimum Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering from an established and accredited post-secondary institutionIt would be great if you had:Knowledge of designing for injection molded fabrication processKnowledge of sealing mechanism, pressure vessel design, high pressure sealing technologiesExperience working in high volume OEM and consumer product design and manufacturing in IndiaExperience in Lean, Six Sigma, or KaizenWhat We Offer:Competitive Salary with Extended Health and Dental benefitsPerformance Bonus Program and Stock OptionsInclusive and Collaborative work environmentEmployee Recognition ProgramTeam Building EventsAnd so much more!Acuva is diverse and inclusive. provide reminders on break in points for new materialCoordinate Discrepant Material Control and Material Review Board processes along with DeviationsDevelop and report on audits, material reviews, deviations, material purges, rework packages and Interim Repair AuthorizationsProvide Technical Document Control (TDC) support for both hard copy and electronic work instructions, as requiredSupport DMC process centersFacilitate timely problem resolution of all Manufacturing/PA issuesCollect data to support Root Cause Analysis and Corrective Action performed by Manufacturing Engineering Development and Integration LeadsSupport the production teams in the development and implementation of continuous improvementSupport initial start-up production processes (MVB/PLP/FPI)Monitor process effectiveness and record issues in Maximo databaseSupport Production Readiness build process on complex builds to resolve potential issues prior to production schedule startSupport Third Shift Production operationsRequired QualificationsUniversity Degree or College diploma in Weld/Manufacturing/Mechanical/Electrical Engineering; Software, electronic design, next generation manufacturing, and material science meet cutting edge industrial design to create our green energy powered, Intelligent outdoor furniture. Every Wrmth product is designed and engineered in Canada, to ensure premium quality and craftsmanship. Job DescriptionDo Something Wonderful! Intel put the Silicon in Silicon Valley. No one else is this obsessed with engineering a brighter future. Every day, we create world changing technology that enriches the lives of every person on earth. So, if you have a big idea, let’s do something wonderful together. Join us, because at Intel, we are building a better tomorrow. Want to learn more? Visit our YouTube Channel or the links below!Life at Intel Diversity at Intel Intel desires entry into market segments served by high performance discrete graphics. Participation in such market segments requires the delivery of reference platforms to downstream customers with sufficient confidence to ramp the design, or a very close derivative, into high volume production quickly. Intel is building this capability and now seeks to expand its discrete graphics Platform Engineering team. Are you interested? Then XPE has an opportunity for you. In XPE, we are responsible for delivering leading GPU solutions for integrated and discrete graphics across market segments, and will continue to deliver a pipeline of innovation, to support the complete Intel platform, including CPU, memory, and accelerators.As a Mechanical Design Engineer your responsibilities will include but notLimited ToDrives end to end graphics platform hardware development and design and translates platforml evel requirements to specifications.Designs, develops, modifies, and evaluates electronic parts, components, PCB, or integrated circuitry for GPU hardware platforms, electrical engineering applications, and equipment.Defines component placement, components trace routing rules, and circuits on a board for GPU platforms.Conducts the board layout from feasibility studies to board tapeout, meeting multidisciplinary platform level requirements.Verifies functionality by leading platform powerons, running comprehensive functionality tests, and utilizing tools to confirm platform configurations are set as expected.Drives design research and verification, development, testing, and utilization of firmware, hardware, components, mechanisms, materials, circuitry processes, packaging, and chassis for GPU platforms including discrete graphics components.Applies deep understanding of feature design and validation, utilizes this knowledge to confirm system compatibility or troubleshoot customer concerns, defines processes for technical platforms, system specifications, input/output, and working parameters for hardware and software compatibility.Drives innovation in high performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies through understanding and driving flows and processes for testing, manufacturing, and debug features of GPUs.Collaborates with platform teams (e.g., architecture, power, power integrity, signal integrity, thermal, mechanical, firmware) to develop highquality GPU systems based on performance needs and industry standards (e.g., PCIe, OAM), recommends optimal place and route, and resolves system development and bringup issues to deliver the best quality for platform.QualificationsWhat we need to see (Minimum Qualifications):Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field with 3+ years relevant experience or a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 2+ years of relevant experience.1+ years of experience designing mechanical solutions utilizing 3D modelling software such as Creo or SolidWorks.1+ years of working with mechanical simulation software such as Abaqus or Ansys.1+ years of experience with thermal mechanical testing/debug/analysis.How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field with 4+ years relevant experience or a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 3+ years of relevant experience.4+ years of experience delivering high performance thermal mechanical solutions for electronics applications (air cooled and/or liquid cooled), such as semiconductor, package, PCB and system design.4+ years of experience understanding the tradeoffs between mechanical, thermal and electrical criteria.4+ years of experience with mechanical part manufacturing processes and surface finish options.3+ years of experience with mechanical fundamentals in the PC eco-system.2+ years of experience working with PCIe, OAM or other desktop or server form factors.1+ years of experience with thermal simulation such as Icepak or Flotherm.Inside this Business GroupThe Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Job role: Mechanical Designer for Space Products- Team Leader
Job Description: Job Description(FRENCH DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW)Mechanical Designer for Space Products– Team LeaderAs a mechanical designer of space products, you will be called upon to collaborate with a multidisciplinary engineering team to develop Photonics products for space applications. As part of one or more project teams, you will be responsible for establishing the concepts of our custom space products for international clients. From the submission phase to the detailed definition, you will define the mechanical assemblies to ensure that the final product meets the specific needs of the customer and can survive the conditions of a defined space environment. As a Team Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities related to its mechanical design in order to ensure the smooth progress of the project.Responsibilities Responsible for mechanical system design of space assemblies: Understand customer requirements.  Propose concepts that meet the requirements including cost targets and manufacturability.  Choose/design the components according to the constraints to be respected.  Integrate concepts from the disciplines of optical, electrical engineering, materials, structural and thermal analysis into a 3D model.  Supervision of mechanical design team to lead mechanical innovations and improvements of the space photonic products in order to accommodate various customer requirements for size, mass, and thermal heat management.  Responsible of overseeing mechanical tasks such as design, simulations, and space qualification test campaigns (TVAC, Vibration, Shock) within the mechanical design team on all space programs.  Overseeing and writing test reports for qualification test campaigns.  Assisting management in writing proposals, milestone presentations and reports.  Perform opto-mechanical design using Solidworks, thermal and vibration simulations using ANSYS.  Elaborate mass and volume budgets Perform radiation analysis and simulations using FASTRAD and OMERE software.  Follow up with mechanical suppliers about manufacturing issues. Qualifications Required Minimum Bachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field 5 year of experience in mechanical structure design and design analysis Strong analytical ability in structural analysis, static & dynamic analysis, frequency response analysis Experience with Solidworks software is must Experience with ANSYS for thermal and vibration analysis is must Knowledge of FASTRAD and OMERE Space or Aerospace experienceExperience with fiber optics is an asset Self starter with the ability to motivate othersAbility to work well within a team Excellent communication skills - both written and verbalConcepteur Mécanique de Produits Spatiaux– Chef d’ÉquipeÀ titre de concepteur mécanique de produits spatiaux, vous serez appelé à collaborer avec une équipe d'ingénierie multidisciplinaire pour développer des produits photoniques à application spatiale. Faisant partie d’une ou plusieurs équipes de projet, vous serez responsable de l’établissement des concepts de nos produits spatiaux personnalisés pour clients internationaux. De la phase de soumission jusqu’à la définition détaillée, vous définirez les composants des assemblages mécaniques afin de vous assurer que le produit final réponde aux besoins spécifiques du client et puisse survivre aux conditions environnementales définies par l’application spatiale. Comme chef d’équipe, vous serez également responsable de la coordination des activités reliées à la conception afin d’assurer une bonne progression du projet.ResponsabilitésResponsable de la conception de systèmes mécaniques d’amplificateurs spatiaux : Comprendre les exigences du client.  Proposer des concepts répondant aux exigences.  Choisir/concevoir les composantes en fonction des contraintes du projet.  Intégrer les concepts provenant des disciplines de plusieurs domaines tels que l’électronique, les matériaux, l’analyse structurelle et thermique dans un modèle 3D.  Supervision de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour diriger les innovations mécaniques et l’amélioration des amplificateurs à fibre spatiales afin de répondre aux diverses exigences des clients en matière de taille, de masse et de gestion thermique de la chaleur.  Responsable de la supervision des tâches mécaniques telles que la conception, les simulations et les campagnes d’essais de qualification spatiale (TVAC, Vibration, Choc, etc.) au sein de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour tous les programmes spatiaux. Superviser et rédiger des rapports de test pour les campagnes de tests de qualification. Aider la direction à rédiger des propositions, des présentations d’étape et des rapports.  Effectuer une conception opto-mécanique à l’aide de Solidworks ainsi que des simulations thermiques et structurelles à l’aide d’ANSYS.  Élaborer des budgets de masse et de volume.  Effectuer l’analyse de radiation via simulation en utilisant les logiciels FASTRAD et OMERE. Faire le suivi de la conformité et qualité des pièces mécaniques avec les fournisseurs.Qualifications minimales requises : Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe.  5 années d’expérience en conception de structures mécaniques et en analyse de conception.  Forte capacité en analyse structurelle, statique et dynamique ainsi qu’en analyse de réponse fréquentielle.  Expérience avec les logiciels Solidworks est indispensable.  Expérience avec ANSYS pour l’analyse thermique et structurelle est indispensable.  Connaissance de FASTRAD et OMERE.  Expérience en aérospatiale est un atout.  Expérience dans le domaine de la fibre optique est un atout.  Capacité à s’auto-motiver.  Bonne capacité à travailler en équipe.  Excellentes compétences en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. InspectorAs an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.TSSA regulates Fuel, Boiler Pressure Vessels, and Elevating Devices (escalators and elevators). Inspector positions are available in each of these three teams in regions across Ontario.Positions are available in:GTATimminsThunder BaySault Saint MarieBruce & Grey CountySouthwestern OntarioAbout Us:  Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the Ontario government. With headquarters in West Toronto, TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The TSSA is currently in the process of transitioning to an Outcome Based Regulator. We are in the process of updating our data systems, improving customer services, and improving our billing processes. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with various skill sets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals. All our employees share a few key traits:We are passionate about public safety.We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.We are committed to life-long learning and development.We operate with the highest integrity.TSSA provides our employees with a great sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the province, and it’s our people who make it possible.Position Summary: Inspectors are represented by the Ontario Public Service Employee Union - OPSEU/SEFPO, Local 546. As an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.We are looking for individuals with strong communication skills, who can present in a concise, clear, and articulate manner. You will need the ability to quickly adapt to change and realign with business priorities. You should have the disposition to follow scientific methods to determine root cause of incidents.Job Responsibilities:Enhance public safety by attending and inspecting scenes of incidents, public complaints relating to program inspection services to determine root causes.Identify appropriate action to prevent re-occurrence including issuance of legal orders.Ensure a positive image of the company and maintain effective relationships by providing timely information to customers (including interpretation/application of TSSA’s Act, Regulations, codes, and standards).Prepare and submit accurate reports within established timeframes; and maintain current electronic and paper records.Contribute to a workplace environment conducive to a high performing team by maintaining positive professional relationships with all members of the TSSA team; share expertise and best-practices; participate in the training and development of others; and provide back-up for colleagues.Demonstrate a commitment to health and safety by working in accordance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and TSSA health and safety procedures, and when on site, customers’ safety procedures, and by identifying and reporting potential and actual risks.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; and participating in professional associations. Job Qualifications:* (Specific qualifications for each team varies and please visit our website for more specific details)As this position requires daily travel, a valid Ontario driver’s license is required.Knowledge and application of Occupational Health and Safety ActIntermediate computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related elevating devicesSelf-starter manages the schedule and works collaboratively with supervisor and the scheduling team to prioritize workSpecific Fuels Inspector qualifications:5+ years experience in the hydrocarbon fuels industry and a thorough knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related Fuels Regulations 210/01, 212/01, 213/01, 215/01, 216/01 and 217/01.A Gas Technician level G2 or an Oil Burner Technician level OBT1/OBT2 is preferred.Liquid Propane (LP) and/or Petroleum Mechanic Certification (PMH/PM2/PH3) and/or Pipeline Inspector Certification (GPI) would be an asset.Knowledge of Codes and Standards and proficiency in the CSA B149.01 - Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code, CSA B149.02 - Propane Storage and Handling Code, CSA B149.03 - Code for the Field Approval of Fuel-Related components on Appliances and Equipment, Liquid Fuel Handling Code and the CSA Z662 - Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems. Specific BPV Inspector qualifications:Qualified to write the Ontario Certificate of Competency and will be able to obtain the National Board 'In-Service' and 'AI' Commission and ‘N’ EndorsementsFive years’ experience in the BPV industry is coupled with a comprehensive understanding of related CSA and ASME BPV codes, the Technical Standards and Safety Act, and BPV RegulationsSpecific Elevating Devices Inspector qualifications:Successful completion of a mechanical, electrical, engineering, or millwright certificationDemonstrated experience in mechanical, electrical, millwright, or engineering backgrounds.Practical field experience in the elevating industry.Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment:TSSA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building and maintaining collaborative, caring, and positive work environments so that our employees bring their whole selves to work each and every day. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status or disability. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  TSSA is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by us regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.  Please note that applicants who receive any conditional offer of employment from TSSA will be required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada as a condition of employment and to maintain their status as fully vaccinated as a condition of continued employment. TSSA will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to grounds protected under the Human Rights Code.
