InspectorAs an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.TSSA regulates Fuel, Boiler Pressure Vessels, and Elevating Devices (escalators and elevators). Inspector positions are available in each of these three teams in regions across Ontario.Positions are available in:GTATimminsThunder BaySault Saint MarieBruce & Grey CountySouthwestern OntarioAbout Us:  Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the Ontario government. With headquarters in West Toronto, TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The TSSA is currently in the process of transitioning to an Outcome Based Regulator. We are in the process of updating our data systems, improving customer services, and improving our billing processes. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with various skill sets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals. All our employees share a few key traits:We are passionate about public safety.We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.We are committed to life-long learning and development.We operate with the highest integrity.TSSA provides our employees with a great sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the province, and it’s our people who make it possible.Position Summary: Inspectors are represented by the Ontario Public Service Employee Union - OPSEU/SEFPO, Local 546. As an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.We are looking for individuals with strong communication skills, who can present in a concise, clear, and articulate manner. You will need the ability to quickly adapt to change and realign with business priorities. You should have the disposition to follow scientific methods to determine root cause of incidents.Job Responsibilities:Enhance public safety by attending and inspecting scenes of incidents, public complaints relating to program inspection services to determine root causes.Identify appropriate action to prevent re-occurrence including issuance of legal orders.Ensure a positive image of the company and maintain effective relationships by providing timely information to customers (including interpretation/application of TSSA’s Act, Regulations, codes, and standards).Prepare and submit accurate reports within established timeframes; and maintain current electronic and paper records.Contribute to a workplace environment conducive to a high performing team by maintaining positive professional relationships with all members of the TSSA team; share expertise and best-practices; participate in the training and development of others; and provide back-up for colleagues.Demonstrate a commitment to health and safety by working in accordance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and TSSA health and safety procedures, and when on site, customers’ safety procedures, and by identifying and reporting potential and actual risks.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; and participating in professional associations. Job Qualifications:* (Specific qualifications for each team varies and please visit our website for more specific details)As this position requires daily travel, a valid Ontario driver’s license is required.Knowledge and application of Occupational Health and Safety ActIntermediate computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related elevating devicesSelf-starter manages the schedule and works collaboratively with supervisor and the scheduling team to prioritize workSpecific Fuels Inspector qualifications:5+ years experience in the hydrocarbon fuels industry and a thorough knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related Fuels Regulations 210/01, 212/01, 213/01, 215/01, 216/01 and 217/01.A Gas Technician level G2 or an Oil Burner Technician level OBT1/OBT2 is preferred.Liquid Propane (LP) and/or Petroleum Mechanic Certification (PMH/PM2/PH3) and/or Pipeline Inspector Certification (GPI) would be an asset.Knowledge of Codes and Standards and proficiency in the CSA B149.01 - Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code, CSA B149.02 - Propane Storage and Handling Code, CSA B149.03 - Code for the Field Approval of Fuel-Related components on Appliances and Equipment, Liquid Fuel Handling Code and the CSA Z662 - Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems. Specific BPV Inspector qualifications:Qualified to write the Ontario Certificate of Competency and will be able to obtain the National Board 'In-Service' and 'AI' Commission and ‘N’ EndorsementsFive years’ experience in the BPV industry is coupled with a comprehensive understanding of related CSA and ASME BPV codes, the Technical Standards and Safety Act, and BPV RegulationsSpecific Elevating Devices Inspector qualifications:Successful completion of a mechanical, electrical, engineering, or millwright certificationDemonstrated experience in mechanical, electrical, millwright, or engineering backgrounds.Practical field experience in the elevating industry.Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment:TSSA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building and maintaining collaborative, caring, and positive work environments so that our employees bring their whole selves to work each and every day. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status or disability. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  TSSA is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by us regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.  Please note that applicants who receive any conditional offer of employment from TSSA will be required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada as a condition of employment and to maintain their status as fully vaccinated as a condition of continued employment. TSSA will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to grounds protected under the Human Rights Code.

Acuva Technologies has developed breakthrough UV-LED water purification solutions for a variety of applications. Our proprietary UV-LED disinfection technology enables clean drinking water by offering a compact water purification solution, integrable with consumer appliances such as water coolers, water dispensers, refrigerators etc. We develop partnerships with OEM companies internationally to adopt cutting edge UV-LED water purification solution into their appliances.We are the recipients of the Greater Vancouver Board of Trade 2022 Business of Distinction Award for Business Growth, the MEET 2022 Innovation Award from the Canadian Institute of Plumbing & Heating (CIPH), the 2019 Global New Product Innovation Award by Frost & Sullivan, the BCIC Ignite Award by the BC Innovation Council, recognized as the Best Presenting Company for Sustainable Technology at the Banff Venture Forum and honoured to be added to the Cleantech Emerging Rocket list by Rocket Builders.Job Summary:Reporting to the VP of Engineering, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be responsible for the detail mechanical and system design of Acuva’s consumer and OEM air and water purification devices and identifying scalable technologies that will enable innovative design solutions at competitive cost and utmost reliability.He/she will collaborate with the R&D, engineering, and production teams as well as suppliers and contract manufacturers to ensure that the designs are aligned with product specifications, suitable for medium/large scale manufacturing and can be manufactured reliably.The Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will evaluate requirements, implement design ideas and analysis, and conduct standard practices such as DFMEA, DFA & DFM with the R&D/engineering teams, suppliers, CM’s and ODM’s. demonstrated skills in consumer product design, sealing mechanism and custom manufacturing technologies such as injection molding, stamping, extrusion, casting and CNC as well as knowledge of part finishing processes for functional and cosmetic requirements.Self-motivated and driven to get results on time with a focus on repeatable quality, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be an We are seeking a skilled General Machinist to join our client's team in Brampton, ON location.Shift - DayResponsibilitiesSet up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts according to engineering drawings and specifications. Utilize manual and computer-controlled machinery, such as lathes, milling machines, drill presses, and grinders, to perform machining operations. Measure and inspect machined parts using precision measuring instruments, ensuring compliance with dimensional tolerances and quality standards. Interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, and work instructions to determine machining processes, tooling requirements, and sequence of operations. Select appropriate cutting tools, speeds, and feeds for each machining operation, optimizing efficiency and ensuring the quality of finished parts. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to machine setup, tooling, and machining processes to maintain productivity and quality standards. Perform routine maintenance tasks on machinery, such as cleaning, lubricating, and replacing worn components, to ensure optimal performance and longevity. Adhere to safety protocols and practices to minimize workplace hazards and promote a safe working environment. Collaborate with engineering, production, and quality assurance teams to optimize manufacturing processes and resolve technical challenges. Continuously strive to improve machining techniques, processes, and efficiencies through innovation and continuous learning. QualificationsMinimum of a high school diploma and Ontario Machinist Certification. At least 5 years of experience in machine shop and fabrication, particularly in producing thermoforming molds or similar applications. Proficiency in various tooling machinery usage, including Milling Machines, Lathes, Drilling Machine, Band saws, Grinders, etc. Ability to verify dimensions of machined parts or tooling using different measuring instruments such as Vernier Calipers, Micrometers, Height gauges, etc. Strong ability to read and interpret blueprints or examine sample parts to determine machining operations required.

An opportunity for a Project Manager/ Estimator to join an established family run contractor in the Lower Mainland! Your new company:Looking to join a widely known and respected, family-owned Mechanical Contractor with over 70 years’ of experience in the industry? Our client is known for providing custom mechanical solutions for institutional & commercial projects across Vancouver and the Lower Mainland. With a long-standing reputation in the area, this client has a secure and long-standing client base and is currently working on multiple large-scale projects. Now on a growth trajectory, our client is ready to bring in a new team member to help them achieve their future goals. Your new role:We are looking for an individual who will be joining this well-established team as a Project Manager/ Estimator (Or Project Coordinator who is looking to become PM). If successful, you will be responsible for ensuring the success of your assigned project(s), including the planning, management, and execution of projects. Day-to-day tasks include but are not limited to, communicating project expectations and goals to other team members, enforcing a site-specific health and safety plan, enforcing schedule deadlines throughout the project, submitting quotations, being responsible for coordination of site drawings, monitoring job costing, and prepare reports for review and other duties as required. You will also be expected to do some estimating. What you’ll need to succeed:To succeed as the Mechanical Project Manager/ Estimator, you will bring 3 - 5+ years in the mechanical construction industry and be eager to learn and grow in the role and with the organization. You will be approachable and professional with customers, proficient in Microsoft Office products, and ideally have experience with estimating. What you’ll get in return:As the Project Manager, you will receive a competitive base salary ($70,000 - $100,000) dependent on experience) 3 weeks’ vacation (excluding Christmas), an extensive benefits plan from day one, and opportunities for professional development. What you need to do now:If this opportunity in the mechanical industry sounds like it could be the right next step within your career, apply now. Your Hays consultant is looking forward to connecting with those who meet the above qualifications to discuss the next steps. Please note all applications are highly confidential.

Pour les besoins de ses opérations de l’usine de Saint-Anselme, Exceldor coopérative est actuellement à la recherche d’un directeur d’usine. Relevant du vice-président, Opérations division poulet et projets majeurs, le titulaire du poste a un rôle de leader auprès des chefs de secteur – production, les superviseurs de production et sanitation, l’équipe maintenance et travaille en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe qualité dans l’implantation des standards. Il est le responsable du bon fonctionnement de l’usine tout en gérant et encadrant l’équipe qui livre les résultats. Il oriente son leadership en plaçant l’humain au cœur de la performance.Responsabilités Planifie, organise, dirige, et contrôle les activités de production et sanitaires de l'usine tout en veillant à la fiabilité opérationnelle, afin d'atteindre les objectifs d'efficacité de rendement et de productivité; Agit comme leader de l’amélioration continue, plus spécifiquement initie l’identification et la priorisation des opportunités d’amélioration continue. Il s’assure de la réalisation du processus, de l’implantation, du suivi des actions ainsi que le maintien des améliorations; Fait le suivi des indicateurs de gestion de l’usine et prend les mesures appropriées ; Agit comme leader positif en instaurant et en maintenant une culture préventive en SST. Il veille au respect des programmes de SST et s’assure d’un suivi rigoureux en conformité avec la réglementation et les politiques en vigueur dans l’optique de maintenir des lieux de travail sécuritaires ; S’assure de la conformité des procédures et veille au respect des normes HACCP/GFSI/SQF et des bonnes pratiques de fabrication, des règles d'hygiène et de sécurité alimentaire. Il maintient l’accréditation HACCP et SQF et s’assure que l’usine est conforme au programme ; Dirige et motive son équipe de travail, planifie les besoins en personnel, participe à la sélection et au développement de ses ressources et évalue son personnel ; Collabore avec l’équipe des ressources humaines à la négociation de la convention collective et veille au maintien des bonnes relations de travail ; Est actif sur différents comités et travaille en étroite collaboration avec les intervenants de plusieurs vice-présidences.Qualifications Requises Détenir un baccalauréat en Administration, Gestion des opérations, Recherche opérationnelle ou tout autre domaine pertinent ; Posséder de 10 à 15 ans d’expérience en gestion de la production et en supervision d’équipe ; Posséder une expérience dans la transformation de la viande ou dans le secteur de la volaille est un atout considérable; Excellente connaissance des normes HACCP, GFSI, SST et des pratiques de fabrication, des règles d'hygiène, de la règlementation en matière de SST et autres ; Leader reconnu dans une gestion collaborative, ouverte et axée sur le travail d’équipe, sur l’évaluation de la performance, la reconnaissance, l’engagement des employés et l’importance de la formation ; Proactivité, capacité d’analyse, capacité de résolution de problèmes et de jugement, dans un environnement où le sens de l’urgence et un rythme de travail rapide sont requis ; Connaissances informatiques (Suite Ms Office, JDE, Dayforce (Ceridian)) ou tout autre outil équivalent ; Le bilinguisme français et anglais est nécessaire dans l’exercice de ces fonctions.

MCI is North America’s public and private market motor coach leader. Products include the luxury J-Series (an industry best-seller for over a decade), the workhorse D-Series, and the brand new zero-emission luxury and commuter coaches: the battery-electric J4500 CHARGE™ and MCI D45 CRT LE CHARGE™. MCI also provides maintenance, repair, 24-hour roadside assistance, parts, and technician training through the industry’s only Automotive Service Excellence (ASE) accredited MCI Academy. Further information is available at www.mcicoach.com.POSITION SUMMARYThis position is accountable for completion of static & dynamic finite element analysis tasks. This will include all related design and analysis activities, calculations, reports, presentations, and communications. The goal is to simulate more and physically test less, where practical. With this position there will be an expectation and a strong emphasis on first time quality releases.WHAT YOU WILL DO:Ensures engineering designs and design changes are analyzed and validated to meet Industry and NFI Group product standards. Works closely with electrical and mechanical designers (and other departments), Able to work independently as well as part of organizational and project teams. Performs FEA/CFD & 2D analysis on new and existing designs, analysis of the results, writing reports, and working with the designer(s) to improve the products to meet all standards. Works with designers to develop validation plans to meet requirements, ordering parts, preparing, and performing tests, and managing outside contractors for additional validation. To validate Engineering Authorized Deviations (EADs) to ensure structural compliance. Work directly with all facets of the organization to provide engineering support to suppliers, production, purchasing, quality assurance, customer service and other departments as required.Conduct fatigue life estimations using simulation.*Ability to travel up to 5% internationally is required*WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:Bachelor's degree in Mechanical engineering, or equivalent.Registered professional engineer or engineer-in-training with APEGM, or equivalent.Strong understanding of carbon steel structures, composites, weld joint classifications and bonding within a manufacturing environment.Experience in Noise, Vibration & Harshness (NVH) is an asset.Working knowledge of Ansys, HyperWorks, AMESim & Fluent software packages an asset.Proficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook).WHY JOIN OUR TEAM:Competitive Wages. A continuous learning environment. Ability to advance your career with a growing company. NFI Group has been named a Manitoba Top Employer for 2020 and this is the tenth since the competition was established in 2007. Employee social committee organizes numerous events throughout the year, including summer barbecues, holiday festivities, sporting events and tournaments, and much more. Ongoing employee development through a variety of in-house training initiatives along with tuition subsidies for courses at outside institutions.OUR WHY: We exist to move people. Our mission is to design and deliver exceptional transportation solutions that are safe, accessible, e­fficient and reliable. NFI Group is a leading independent global bus manufacturer providing a comprehensive suite of mass transportation solutions. News and information is available at www.nfigroup.com, www.newflyer.com, www.mcicoach.com, www.nfi.parts, www.alexander-dennis.com, www.arbocsv.com, and www.carfaircomposites.com.

Company: Ontario Transit Group - Ontario Line - Southern Civil, Stations & Tunnel
Job Description: Company DescriptionAre you looking for your next adventure? Let us tell you all about it! The project team at Ontario Transit Group are so proud to be part of Ontario’s future.Ontario Line SouthOur team is mobilizing its design and construction crews, with major works to commence in 2023. The South Civil contract is anticipated to be completed in 2030.The project will strengthen Ontario’s economy by supporting an estimated 1,500 jobs at the peak of construction.What is the project?A six-kilometre tunnel and associated tunnelling works from Exhibition to Don Yard portal (west of the Don River)Stations:One above-ground station to be integrated with the existing GO Transit Exhibition StationTwo underground stations to be integrated with the existing TTC Osgoode and Queen subway stationsFour new underground stations (King/Bathurst, Queen/Spadina, Moss Park, Corktown. The Benefits to Ontario?Faster, more frequent and reliable access to rapid transit with more than 227,500 people will live within a 10-minute walk of an Ontario Line stationImproving the quality of life for commuters by reducing daily travel timeReducing crowding on the existing Line 1 (Yonge-University) subwayUp to 57,000 more jobs will be accessible by transit (in 45 minutes or less) for Toronto residentsEconomic and community growth along the future transit line and thousands of job opportunities annually during constructionReduction in traffic congestion, greenhouse gases and fuel consumption by providing an alternative transportation optionJob DescriptionA Geo-structural Instrumentation and Monitoring Technician for the Southern Civil, Stations, and Tunnel project is an interdisciplinary role in heavy civil engineering and geotechnical engineering. The primary responsibility of this field-office role is to assist the Senior Instrumentation Technician in installing, operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting geo-structural instrumentation and monitoring systems used for the different construction faces of project. These systems measure and monitor various geotechnical and structural parameters in real-time, such as ground movements, deformations, stresses, loads, noise, and vibrations.The specific job duties of a Geo-structural Instrumentation and Monitoring Technician may include:Conducting site visits to plan and determine the appropriate tools and equipment required for specific instrumentation installations and installing instrumentation and monitoring systems in accordance with project specifications and requirements. Leading the field works for installing sensors, including strain gauges, tiltmeters, inclinometers, SAAV, MPBX, piezometers, and other monitoring devices and data acquisition systems. Providing technical support to the construction teamInstallation, configuration, and maintenance of dataloggers and accessories: Modems, interfaces, multiplexors, antennas, signal cables, and solar panels, batteries to ensure that data is collected correctly and without interruptions. Perform Manual readings and download/record data and prepare factual reports, summaries, data sheets, or graphs to assist the instrumentation specialist with data interpretation linked to construction processes. Providing technical recommendations for modifications and repairs to instrumentation and monitoring systems. Communicating effectively with engineers, contractors, and other project stakeholders on issues or works relating to monitoring and instrumentation and participating in site and staff planning and safety meetings. Help maintain databases of instrumentation records, calibration certificates of instruments and unit readouts, equipment manuals, and applicable standards. This position entails flexible working hours, including both day and night shifts, to fulfill the demands of city operations. Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all subcontractors, CA prime representatives, and stakeholders. Performing other related duties as required and maintaining a working knowledge of current instrumentation technology and trends in the industry. Executing diligently prescribed company technical procedures, safe work, environmental practices, and work plans. QualificationsThe ideal candidate for this role should have a two-year diploma in civil engineering, electronics engineering, communications engineering, or a related field, with experience in geo-structural instrumentation and monitoring systems. They should also have excellent communication and problem-solving skills, work well in a team and be familiar with standard industry software and data analysis tools.We expect that Geo-structural Instrumentation and Monitoring Technician has at least 2 years of experience working on heavy civil construction projects. Good understanding of electronics, coding in python and using programming tools such as CRBasic editor, civil engineering, and construction procedures. Strong technical writing skills, and ability to present information concisely and clearly in reports. Proficient with the use of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint);Ability to handle multi-tasking and maintain focus in a busy workplace. Good understanding of local Occupational and Health and Safety Policies and regulationsAbility to meet tight deadlines and work under pressure. Must be available on occasion to work evenings, nights, and weekends to meet project needs. Ability to provide innovative solutions, problem-solve and tackle new assignments effectively and efficiently. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Industry Category: Manufacturing, Machinery Manufacturing, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
Job Description: Decisive Dividend is an acquisition-oriented company focused on opportunities in manufacturing. Our purpose is to be the sought-out choice for exiting legacy-minded business owners, while supporting the long-term success of the businesses acquired. Through that, we create sustainable and growing shareholder returns.Buy- We use a disciplined acquisition strategy to identify profitable, well-established, high quality manufacturing companies. We look for a sustainable competitive advantage, steady cash flows, growth potential and established, strong leadership with enterprise values up to $25 million.Build-We support the long-term success of the businesses acquired, with resources to help them achieve their potential. We recognize that those running the business know it better than we do.Hold-We care about continuing the business legacies of the vendors whose companies we acquire and are committed to the communities our businesses are located in. We do not buy a company to sell itDIRECTOR, SPECIAL PROJECTS OPERATIONS POSITION SUMMARYReporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Director of Special Projects Operations, is a client-faced position playing a crucial role in ensuring the success of our operational projects, acquisitions, and integrations. In this hands-on role, you would work closely with our subsidiaries leadership to understand their needs, develop tailored solutions, and ensure the successful execution of projects from start to finish.Key Responsibilities:Due Diligence Assistance: Support Decisive Dividend’s acquisition team in conducting due diligence for potential acquisitions by gathering and organizing relevant data, assisting in analysis, and providing administrative support throughout the process.Post-Integration Support: Providing ongoing support to ensure that the integration is successful in the long term and addressing any lingering issues or challenges that arise after the initial integration phase.Project planning: Collaborate with subsidiaries to understand their objectives, requirements, and expectation for a project, including developing comprehensive project plans that outline the scope, objectives, timelines, resources, and budget for each project.Cross-Functional Coordination: Act as a liaison between various departments such as engineering, production, supply chain, and quality assurance, facilitating collaboration and ensuring alignment on project goals and objectives.Continuous Improvement Support: Foster a culture of continuous improvement by providing support for initiatives such as lean manufacturing principles, root cause analysis, and implementation of improvement plans.Safety Guidance: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate safety considerations into manufacturing processes, equipment design, and facility layouts.Quality Assurance Assistance: Collaborate with quality assurance teams to ensure that process improvements align with regulatory requirements and quality standards, providing support in compliance efforts.Travel requirements: this position requires extensive travel Requirements:Bachelor's degree in engineering, business administration, operations management, or related field.Proven experience in a client-facing role, preferably in a manufacturing environment10 plus years previous experience in project support or coordination within a manufacturing environmentStrong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and project management software.Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.Commitment to teamwork, collaboration, and continuous learning.Salary range: The salary range is $120,000 to $140,000, with variations based on factors like experience, education and skills. Experienced candidates are encouraged to apply, even if the salary range is below their expectations, please indicate range when submitting your resume.

Position:                     Shift Supervisor – Extrusion (Press)  The Company:            APEL Extrusions  APEL Extrusions Limited is an independent extruder, finisher and fabricator of aluminum profiles servicing the commercial, residential, and industrial markets of Western Canada. Situated in Calgary, Canada, APEL Extrusions occupies 110,000 square feet of modern manufacturing space employing approximately 110 people. Search:            Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Extrusion Supervisor will be responsible for production activities in the Extrusion Department for a given shift at the APEL manufacturing facility. APEL runs 24-hour operations, operating 7 days per week. Given 24-hour operations, shift rotation is a requirement for this position. The Extrusion Supervisor will have approximately 16-20 direct reports and be an active participant in APEL’s Leadership Group.  In addition to the production responsibilities, the Shift Supervisor’s role will involve extensive liaison with all areas of the company. Activities include but are not limited to managing resources and schedules in the Extrusion Department (2 presses) and the Die Shop. Key deliverables involve ensuring the extrusion department meets or exceeds safety, production, cost, and quality objectives. General duties are to: Job Responsibilities: Delegate, manage and coordinate production teams to effectively utilize the people, equipment and materials required to meet production schedules.Anticipate and identify departmental bottlenecks and take corrective action.Make ongoing operational decisions that adhere to budget requirements and sales goals.Work closely with related departments to meet customer expectations for delivery and quality.Foster an environment of teamwork, learning and continuous improvement.Place a strong emphasis on safety and environmental requirements. Play an active role in company wide Lean Manufacturing initiatives. Basic Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have at least 4 years of manufacturing experience with a minimum of 2 years of production management responsibility.  Experience in an aluminum extrusion environment with a focus on press operations is a decided asset.Post secondary education in management, engineering or manufacturing would be beneficial.Proven experience managing people and priorities in a unionized environment.Education and training in Safety and Quality.Exposure to Lean Manufacturing concepts. Compensation:            Excellent remuneration and benefits package commensurate with experience. Contact: Interested applicants are invited to submit their resumes to APEL Human Resources at hrcalgary@apelextrusions.com or fax resumes to 403-236-2944 (attention Human Resources).No telephone inquiries please.APEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. APEL thanks all applicants for their interest, but only selected candidates will be contacted.

Job Description: DescriptionAre you passionate about engineering and railway transportation? Do you enjoy being at the heart of operations, working on various systems and equipment? Prepare technical documentation (BOM, drawings, 3D models, procedures, technical specifications, etc.); Optimize the performance and reliability of mechanical systems, identify the root causes of failures, and recommend design improvements; Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine maintenance needs and update maintenance plans; Ensure that safety aspects of the system are considered throughout the design process; Serve as a liaison with contractors, workshop personnel, and other groups; Evaluate technical information submitted by consultants, contractors, manufacturers, and suppliers and participate in acceptance testing.Requirements Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering; Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role; Experience with concepts of system reliability and maintenance programs; Proficiency in CAO software, SolidWorks, AutoCAD; Strong command of the Microsoft Office suite; Excellent ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing (English and French); Knowledge of components within rolling stock systems, such as doors, stepboards, air and water conduits, etc. (an asset).SkillsCollaboration and teamwork: Ability to work effectively with others to create a harmonious work environmentLeadership: Must have the ability to guide and influenceEmotional intelligence: Excellent management of emotionsPolitical savvy: Ability to understand and navigate political aspectsWork ethic: Must set an example in terms of commitment and determinationAnalytical and synthesis skills: Capable of analyzing complex situations, synthesizing information, and making informed decisions based on a future visionAdaptability and agility: Must be able to quickly adapt to changes and demonstrate agility in managing varied situations.Influence: Able to positively influence others and mobilize their supportOrganization and time management: Excellent planning ability to effectively manage time and maximize efficiencyCourage to act: Demonstrate courage and take initiatives to face difficult situations;At VIA Rail, we are proud to be an employment-equity employer and we strive to form teams that reflect the diversity of Canadian society. All information received in relation to arrangements will be kept confidential.Note that we will only contact those who are selected for an interview.#VIAENG

We are a fast-growing international high-tech company offering high-performance non-destructive testing solutions for the inspection of critical components. Our instruments have applications in a variety of industries, including oil & gas, aerospace and nuclear.Are you up for a challenge in the world of high-tech? We'd love to have you on board! Follow-up with the production team and update our manufacturing and assembly drawings based on feedback.  Under limited supervision, participate in the design of new probes, modifications, testing and realization of industrial eddy current systems.  Integrate industrial design concepts into Eddyfi products to optimize design quality, manufacturing processes, cost & customer functionality.  Provide specialist judgement & analysis in the design, development & implementation of new application solutions.  Support the sales team in the submission of products tailored to specific customer requirements. What We Are Looking For Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering  2 to 5 years' relevant experience  Experience in miniature equipment design (micro-machining) an asset  Knowledge of Solidworks and PDM drawing software  Knowledge of SolidEdge drawing software an asset  Knowledge of machining methods (digital)  Ability to work on several projects simultaneously  Excellent organizational skills with limited direction  Structured development approach  Excellent knowledge of dimensional and geometric tolerancing  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Functional English You Will Be Offered Flexible working hours;  Remote working available;  New workspaces in an illuminated and modern working environment;  Three weeks minimum vacation upon hiring;  Five paid holidays (in addition to statutory holidays) during the close of business for the holiday season;  Five floating holidays per year;  Group insurance and a competitive RRSP program;  An on-site gym with fun "trainings" or yoga at lunchtime;  Catering service at affordable prices with employer contributions;  Reimbursement of contributions to a professional order;  Parking and electrical terminals;  Free coffee;  Entertaining activities organized regularly by the Social Club. Job DescriptionDo Something Wonderful! Intel put the Silicon in Silicon Valley. No one else is this obsessed with engineering a brighter future. Every day, we create world changing technology that enriches the lives of every person on earth. So, if you have a big idea, let’s do something wonderful together. Join us, because at Intel, we are building a better tomorrow. Want to learn more? Visit our YouTube Channel or the links below!Life at Intel Diversity at Intel Intel desires entry into market segments served by high performance discrete graphics. Participation in such market segments requires the delivery of reference platforms to downstream customers with sufficient confidence to ramp the design, or a very close derivative, into high volume production quickly. Intel is building this capability and now seeks to expand its discrete graphics Platform Engineering team. Are you interested? Then XPE has an opportunity for you. In XPE, we are responsible for delivering leading GPU solutions for integrated and discrete graphics across market segments, and will continue to deliver a pipeline of innovation, to support the complete Intel platform, including CPU, memory, and accelerators.As a Mechanical Design Engineer your responsibilities will include but notLimited ToDrives end to end graphics platform hardware development and design and translates platforml evel requirements to specifications.Designs, develops, modifies, and evaluates electronic parts, components, PCB, or integrated circuitry for GPU hardware platforms, electrical engineering applications, and equipment.Defines component placement, components trace routing rules, and circuits on a board for GPU platforms.Conducts the board layout from feasibility studies to board tapeout, meeting multidisciplinary platform level requirements.Verifies functionality by leading platform powerons, running comprehensive functionality tests, and utilizing tools to confirm platform configurations are set as expected.Drives design research and verification, development, testing, and utilization of firmware, hardware, components, mechanisms, materials, circuitry processes, packaging, and chassis for GPU platforms including discrete graphics components.Applies deep understanding of feature design and validation, utilizes this knowledge to confirm system compatibility or troubleshoot customer concerns, defines processes for technical platforms, system specifications, input/output, and working parameters for hardware and software compatibility.Drives innovation in high performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies through understanding and driving flows and processes for testing, manufacturing, and debug features of GPUs.Collaborates with platform teams (e.g., architecture, power, power integrity, signal integrity, thermal, mechanical, firmware) to develop highquality GPU systems based on performance needs and industry standards (e.g., PCIe, OAM), recommends optimal place and route, and resolves system development and bringup issues to deliver the best quality for platform.QualificationsWhat we need to see (Minimum Qualifications):Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field with 3+ years relevant experience or a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 2+ years of relevant experience.1+ years of experience designing mechanical solutions utilizing 3D modelling software such as Creo or SolidWorks.1+ years of working with mechanical simulation software such as Abaqus or Ansys.1+ years of experience with thermal mechanical testing/debug/analysis.How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field with 4+ years relevant experience or a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 3+ years of relevant experience.4+ years of experience delivering high performance thermal mechanical solutions for electronics applications (air cooled and/or liquid cooled), such as semiconductor, package, PCB and system design.4+ years of experience understanding the tradeoffs between mechanical, thermal and electrical criteria.4+ years of experience with mechanical part manufacturing processes and surface finish options.3+ years of experience with mechanical fundamentals in the PC eco-system.2+ years of experience working with PCIe, OAM or other desktop or server form factors.1+ years of experience with thermal simulation such as Icepak or Flotherm.Inside this Business GroupThe Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Working with our partners across the industry, we intend to deliver purposeful computing experiences that unlock people's potential - allowing each person use our products to focus, create and connect in ways that matter most to them. As the largest business unit at Intel, CCG is investing more heavily in the PC, ramping its capabilities even more aggressively, and designing the PC experience even more deliberately, including delivering a predictable cadence of leadership products. As a result, we are able to fuel innovation across Intel, providing an important source of IP and scale, as well as help the company deliver on its purpose of enriching the lives of every person on earth.Posting StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.BenefitsWe offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Job DescriptionWe are seeking a skilled CNC Millwork Programmer to join our team. As a CNC Millwork Programmer, you will be responsible for creating, optimizing, and maintaining CNC programs to produce high-quality millwork products. This role requires proficiency in CAD/CAM software, strong attention to detail, and the ability to interpret technical drawings accurately.Responsibilities:Program and operate CNC milling machines to produce millwork components according to technical drawings and specifications. Document CNC programs, tooling setups, and production processes for future reference and continuous improvement. Train and mentor junior CNC operators on programming techniques, machine operation, and safety protocols. Stay updated on industry trends, advancements in CNC technology, and best practices in millwork fabrication. Proven experience as a CNC Millwork Programmer or similar role in a manufacturing environment. Proficiency in CAD/CAM software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Mastercam) for creating and editing CNC programs. Strong knowledge of CNC machining principles, including toolpath generation, feeds and speeds optimization, and G-code programming. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, blueprints, and schematics. Familiarity with woodworking materials, processes, and quality standards. Effective communication and teamwork skills. Commitment to safety and compliance with industry regulations. Willingness to work flexible hours as needed to meet production deadlines. Job role: Mechanical Designer for Space Products- Team Leader
Job Description: Job Description(FRENCH DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW)Mechanical Designer for Space Products– Team LeaderAs a mechanical designer of space products, you will be called upon to collaborate with a multidisciplinary engineering team to develop Photonics products for space applications. As part of one or more project teams, you will be responsible for establishing the concepts of our custom space products for international clients. From the submission phase to the detailed definition, you will define the mechanical assemblies to ensure that the final product meets the specific needs of the customer and can survive the conditions of a defined space environment. As a Team Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities related to its mechanical design in order to ensure the smooth progress of the project.Responsibilities Responsible for mechanical system design of space assemblies: Understand customer requirements.  Propose concepts that meet the requirements including cost targets and manufacturability.  Choose/design the components according to the constraints to be respected.  Integrate concepts from the disciplines of optical, electrical engineering, materials, structural and thermal analysis into a 3D model.  Supervision of mechanical design team to lead mechanical innovations and improvements of the space photonic products in order to accommodate various customer requirements for size, mass, and thermal heat management.  Responsible of overseeing mechanical tasks such as design, simulations, and space qualification test campaigns (TVAC, Vibration, Shock) within the mechanical design team on all space programs.  Overseeing and writing test reports for qualification test campaigns.  Assisting management in writing proposals, milestone presentations and reports.  Perform opto-mechanical design using Solidworks, thermal and vibration simulations using ANSYS.  Elaborate mass and volume budgets Perform radiation analysis and simulations using FASTRAD and OMERE software.  Follow up with mechanical suppliers about manufacturing issues. Qualifications Required Minimum Bachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field 5 year of experience in mechanical structure design and design analysis Strong analytical ability in structural analysis, static & dynamic analysis, frequency response analysis Experience with Solidworks software is must Experience with ANSYS for thermal and vibration analysis is must Knowledge of FASTRAD and OMERE Space or Aerospace experienceExperience with fiber optics is an asset Self starter with the ability to motivate othersAbility to work well within a team Excellent communication skills - both written and verbalConcepteur Mécanique de Produits Spatiaux– Chef d’ÉquipeÀ titre de concepteur mécanique de produits spatiaux, vous serez appelé à collaborer avec une équipe d'ingénierie multidisciplinaire pour développer des produits photoniques à application spatiale. Faisant partie d’une ou plusieurs équipes de projet, vous serez responsable de l’établissement des concepts de nos produits spatiaux personnalisés pour clients internationaux. De la phase de soumission jusqu’à la définition détaillée, vous définirez les composants des assemblages mécaniques afin de vous assurer que le produit final réponde aux besoins spécifiques du client et puisse survivre aux conditions environnementales définies par l’application spatiale. Comme chef d’équipe, vous serez également responsable de la coordination des activités reliées à la conception afin d’assurer une bonne progression du projet.ResponsabilitésResponsable de la conception de systèmes mécaniques d’amplificateurs spatiaux : Comprendre les exigences du client.  Proposer des concepts répondant aux exigences.  Choisir/concevoir les composantes en fonction des contraintes du projet.  Intégrer les concepts provenant des disciplines de plusieurs domaines tels que l’électronique, les matériaux, l’analyse structurelle et thermique dans un modèle 3D.  Supervision de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour diriger les innovations mécaniques et l’amélioration des amplificateurs à fibre spatiales afin de répondre aux diverses exigences des clients en matière de taille, de masse et de gestion thermique de la chaleur.  Responsable de la supervision des tâches mécaniques telles que la conception, les simulations et les campagnes d’essais de qualification spatiale (TVAC, Vibration, Choc, etc.) au sein de l’équipe de conception mécanique pour tous les programmes spatiaux. Superviser et rédiger des rapports de test pour les campagnes de tests de qualification. Aider la direction à rédiger des propositions, des présentations d’étape et des rapports.  Effectuer une conception opto-mécanique à l’aide de Solidworks ainsi que des simulations thermiques et structurelles à l’aide d’ANSYS.  Élaborer des budgets de masse et de volume.  Effectuer l’analyse de radiation via simulation en utilisant les logiciels FASTRAD et OMERE. Faire le suivi de la conformité et qualité des pièces mécaniques avec les fournisseurs.Qualifications minimales requises : Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe.  5 années d’expérience en conception de structures mécaniques et en analyse de conception.  Forte capacité en analyse structurelle, statique et dynamique ainsi qu’en analyse de réponse fréquentielle.  Expérience avec les logiciels Solidworks est indispensable.  Expérience avec ANSYS pour l’analyse thermique et structurelle est indispensable.  Connaissance de FASTRAD et OMERE.  Expérience en aérospatiale est un atout.  Expérience dans le domaine de la fibre optique est un atout.  Capacité à s’auto-motiver.  Bonne capacité à travailler en équipe.  Excellentes compétences en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. Job DescriptionWe are looking for an experienced Millwright who has experience in Manufacturing company for our client located at Mississauga. It is a candle manufacturing company.Responsibilities:  Conduct preventive maintenance procedures to ensure optimal performance.  Collaborate with team members to identify and address mechanical issues.  Always adhere to safety protocols and regulations.  Keep accurate records of maintenance activities.  Maintain and service machines and equipment used in the manufacturing facility.  Inspect and assess machinery to detect irregularities and malfunctions. Strong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities. Location: MississaugaShift: All Shift (Mon – Fri)Pay Rate: $34/hr. to $36/hr. (depending upon experience)

Nous sommes fiers de fournir des solutions d'ingénierie exceptionnelles, une conception innovante, un service efficace et un leadership de confiance depuis la phase de conception jusqu'au processus d'approbation et de certification. L'équipe AIRHAWKE compte plus de 30 personnes collaboratives, est localisée dans des endroits différents du monde entier notamment au Canada, aux États-Unis et en Europe. Soutenu par une équipe de direction qui s'efforce d'encourager et d’habiliter, l'équipe AIRHAWKE est imparable. Dans votre fonction, reportant directement au directeur qualité, vous serez/amené à :Rapporter directement au directeur de l’ingénierie.Travailler en design avec le soutien et sous la supervision du Lead d'ingénierie attribué au projet.Générer des modèles 3D, des dessins de travail 2D et des plans détaillés 2D en utilisant CATIA V5, AutoCAD et/ou Solidworks.Exécuter les travaux selon les écheances convenu tout en respectant les contraintes de conception, les lignes directrices et les normes.Préparer des présentations. Qualifications :Être un joueur d’équipe motivé, axé sur les détails, qui démontre de bonnes compétences organisationnelles et de communication.Capacité à se diriger de manière autonome avec initiative et proactivité.Un minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience pertinente dans l'industrie de l'aviation en finitions d’intérieur et expérience en systèmes serait un atout.Maîtrise de CATIA V5 (Workbench Mécanique) & AutoCAD.Expérience en conception de formes génératives au sein de CATIA V5 & 3DX PLM serait un atout.Maîtrise de la langue française et anglaise écrite et orale.Diplôme de collège en conception ou diplôme universitaire en aérospatiale ou en génie mécanique. NOTRE CULTURE D'ÉQUIPEChez AIRHAWKE, nous nous efforçons de créer une culture d'équipe forte qui favorise la collaboration, l'innovation, la confiance et le respect entre les membres de l'équipe. Nous sommes non seulement convaincus qu'il s'agit d'un meilleur lieu de travail, mais aussi que cela se traduit par une productivité et une satisfaction professionnelle accrues. Tout le monde y gagne.ÉQUITÉ, DIVERSITÉ ET INCLUSIONNous fondons notre recrutement sur le principe de l'égalité des chances. Nous croyons fermement en la valeur de chaque être humain, indépendamment de sa naissance ou de ses origines, et tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération.Nous visons à augmenter le nombre de nos employés issus de groupes sous-représentés et cherchons à les aider à développer leur carrière chez nous. Nous encourageons aussi activement les femmes à poursuivre des carrières dans le domaine des STIM (sciences, technologies, ingénierie et mathématiques) et à postuler à des emplois chez AIRHAWKE.AVANTAGES DE TRAVAILLER AVEC NOUSFlexibilité du travail à distancePrestations médicales familiales complètesEnvironnement de travail durableÉvolution de carrièreAssurance vie familialeTravail d'équipe caritatifUn fort esprit d'équipeSiège social rénovéVoyagesFormation continueCollations et boissons gratuitesPaquet de vacances compétitifRéunions sociales de l'équipeNous remercions tous les candidats pour leur intérêt, cependant, seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.https://www.airhawke.com

An opportunity for a Project Manager/ Estimator to join an established family run contractor in the Lower Mainland! Your new company:Looking to join a widely known and respected, family-owned Mechanical Contractor with over 70 years’ of experience in the industry? Our client is known for providing custom mechanical solutions for institutional & commercial projects across Vancouver and the Lower Mainland. With a long-standing reputation in the area, this client has a secure and long-standing client base and is currently working on multiple large-scale projects. Now on a growth trajectory, our client is ready to bring in a new team member to help them achieve their future goals. Your new role:We are looking for an individual who will be joining this well-established team as a Project Manager/ Estimator (Or Project Coordinator who is looking to become PM). If successful, you will be responsible for ensuring the success of your assigned project(s), including the planning, management, and execution of projects. Day-to-day tasks include but are not limited to, communicating project expectations and goals to other team members, enforcing a site-specific health and safety plan, enforcing schedule deadlines throughout the project, submitting quotations, being responsible for coordination of site drawings, monitoring job costing, and prepare reports for review and other duties as required. You will also be expected to do some estimating. What you’ll need to succeed:To succeed as the Mechanical Project Manager/ Estimator, you will bring 3 - 5+ years in the mechanical construction industry and be eager to learn and grow in the role and with the organization. You will need to be familiar with Mechanical Contracting and associated components, be detail-oriented, and be someone who can work independently, though also work well in a team. You will be approachable and professional with customers, proficient in Microsoft Office products, and ideally have experience with estimating. What you’ll get in return:As the Project Manager, you will receive a competitive base salary ($70,000 - $100,000) dependent on experience) 3 weeks’ vacation (excluding Christmas), an extensive benefits plan from day one, and opportunities for professional development. You will be joining a close-knit team that values work-life balance and family, but also works hard to maintain its reputation are excited to find someone who can join the team to help them grow. What you need to do now:If this opportunity in the mechanical industry sounds like it could be the right next step within your career, apply now. Your Hays consultant is looking forward to connecting with those who meet the above qualifications to discuss the next steps. Please note all applications are highly confidential.

InspectorAs an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.TSSA regulates Fuel, Boiler Pressure Vessels, and Elevating Devices (escalators and elevators). Inspector positions are available in each of these three teams in regions across Ontario.Positions are available in:GTATimminsThunder BaySault Saint MarieBruce & Grey CountySouthwestern OntarioAbout Us:  Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the Ontario government. With headquarters in West Toronto, TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The TSSA is currently in the process of transitioning to an Outcome Based Regulator. We are in the process of updating our data systems, improving customer services, and improving our billing processes. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with various skill sets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals. All our employees share a few key traits:We are passionate about public safety.We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.We are committed to life-long learning and development.We operate with the highest integrity.TSSA provides our employees with a great sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the province, and it’s our people who make it possible.Position Summary: Inspectors are represented by the Ontario Public Service Employee Union - OPSEU/SEFPO, Local 546. As an Inspector, you will enhance public safety and improve service delivery to customers by applying expert knowledge in your field to inspect and audit facilities and equipment governed by the Technical Standards and Safety Act and related regulations. Inspectors also investigate industrial, commercial, incidents, and public complaints relating to potentially unsafe operating conditions.We are looking for individuals with strong communication skills, who can present in a concise, clear, and articulate manner. You will need the ability to quickly adapt to change and realign with business priorities. You should have the disposition to follow scientific methods to determine root cause of incidents.Job Responsibilities:Enhance public safety by attending and inspecting scenes of incidents, public complaints relating to program inspection services to determine root causes.Identify appropriate action to prevent re-occurrence including issuance of legal orders.Ensure a positive image of the company and maintain effective relationships by providing timely information to customers (including interpretation/application of TSSA’s Act, Regulations, codes, and standards).Prepare and submit accurate reports within established timeframes; and maintain current electronic and paper records.Contribute to a workplace environment conducive to a high performing team by maintaining positive professional relationships with all members of the TSSA team; share expertise and best-practices; participate in the training and development of others; and provide back-up for colleagues.Demonstrate a commitment to health and safety by working in accordance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and TSSA health and safety procedures, and when on site, customers’ safety procedures, and by identifying and reporting potential and actual risks.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; and participating in professional associations. Job Qualifications:* (Specific qualifications for each team varies and please visit our website for more specific details)As this position requires daily travel, a valid Ontario driver’s license is required.Knowledge and application of Occupational Health and Safety ActIntermediate computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related elevating devicesSelf-starter manages the schedule and works collaboratively with supervisor and the scheduling team to prioritize workSpecific Fuels Inspector qualifications:5+ years experience in the hydrocarbon fuels industry and a thorough knowledge of the Technical Standards & Safety Act and related Fuels Regulations 210/01, 212/01, 213/01, 215/01, 216/01 and 217/01.A Gas Technician level G2 or an Oil Burner Technician level OBT1/OBT2 is preferred.Liquid Propane (LP) and/or Petroleum Mechanic Certification (PMH/PM2/PH3) and/or Pipeline Inspector Certification (GPI) would be an asset.Knowledge of Codes and Standards and proficiency in the CSA B149.01 - Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code, CSA B149.02 - Propane Storage and Handling Code, CSA B149.03 - Code for the Field Approval of Fuel-Related components on Appliances and Equipment, Liquid Fuel Handling Code and the CSA Z662 - Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems. Specific BPV Inspector qualifications:Qualified to write the Ontario Certificate of Competency and will be able to obtain the National Board 'In-Service' and 'AI' Commission and ‘N’ EndorsementsFive years’ experience in the BPV industry is coupled with a comprehensive understanding of related CSA and ASME BPV codes, the Technical Standards and Safety Act, and BPV RegulationsSpecific Elevating Devices Inspector qualifications:Successful completion of a mechanical, electrical, engineering, or millwright certificationDemonstrated experience in mechanical, electrical, millwright, or engineering backgrounds.Practical field experience in the elevating industry.Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment:TSSA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building and maintaining collaborative, caring, and positive work environments so that our employees bring their whole selves to work each and every day. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status or disability. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  TSSA is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by us regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.  Please note that applicants who receive any conditional offer of employment from TSSA will be required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada as a condition of employment and to maintain their status as fully vaccinated as a condition of continued employment. TSSA will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to grounds protected under the Human Rights Code.

The Engineering Assistant plays a vital role in ensuring efficient communication, documentation, and coordination within the engineering department. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS • Provide CAD support for the engineering team on an as-needed basis. • Work with IEM systems to create bill of materials when needed. • Act as an interface between production and the engineering team. • Work with production leads to bring issues to engineering. • Provide regular updates to the engineering team on equipment production status. • Generate reports at routine intervals for upcoming commitment dates, milestones, etc. • Provide onboarding support for new engineers. • Review for accuracy and processing of Engineering Transmittals. Acuva Technologies has developed breakthrough UV-LED water purification solutions for a variety of applications. Our proprietary UV-LED disinfection technology enables clean drinking water by offering a compact water purification solution, integrable with consumer appliances such as water coolers, water dispensers, refrigerators etc. We develop partnerships with OEM companies internationally to adopt cutting edge UV-LED water purification solution into their appliances.We are the recipients of the Greater Vancouver Board of Trade 2022 Business of Distinction Award for Business Growth, the MEET 2022 Innovation Award from the Canadian Institute of Plumbing & Heating (CIPH), the 2019 Global New Product Innovation Award by Frost & Sullivan, the BCIC Ignite Award by the BC Innovation Council, recognized as the Best Presenting Company for Sustainable Technology at the Banff Venture Forum and honoured to be added to the Cleantech Emerging Rocket list by Rocket Builders.Job Summary:Reporting to the VP of Engineering, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be responsible for the detail mechanical and system design of Acuva’s consumer and OEM air and water purification devices and identifying scalable technologies that will enable innovative design solutions at competitive cost and utmost reliability.He/she will collaborate with the R&D, engineering, and production teams as well as suppliers and contract manufacturers to ensure that the designs are aligned with product specifications, suitable for medium/large scale manufacturing and can be manufactured reliably.The Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will evaluate requirements, implement design ideas and analysis, and conduct standard practices such as DFMEA, DFA & DFM with the R&D/engineering teams, suppliers, CM’s and ODM’s. He/she will also be proficient in simulation tools for FEA and Moldflow, as a minimum the candidate must be able to interpret the results from simulations.The successful candidate will have demonstrated skills in consumer product design, sealing mechanism and custom manufacturing technologies such as injection molding, stamping, extrusion, casting and CNC as well as knowledge of part finishing processes for functional and cosmetic requirements.Self-motivated and driven to get results on time with a focus on repeatable quality, the Senior Mechanical/NPI Engineer will be an effective communicator with excellent oral and written communication skills (English), and able to make simple accurate recommendations when confronted with complex time-sensitive situations.What you will be doing:With the R&D team conceptualize and create mechanical designs for feasibilityWorking closely with Supply Chain, validate tooling DFM, Tool costs and part costs for custom designed mechanical partsDevelop detail mechanical and system designs of OEM and consumer water disinfection appliancesReview product designs for risk and provide risk mitigation plans for the implementation of New, Unique, Different or Difficult (NUDD’s)Clearly report and recommend design improvements based on theoretical analysis and discussions with suppliers, engineering, and operations teamManage PDM part management systems and Engineering Change Request processesDefine protocols and criteria for validation of mechanical parts and productsRoot cause analysis for device failures and propose design/process corrective actionsTechnical interface between Acuva and vendor partners for new product development and introductionConceptualize and design product test jigs to streamline mass volume production of an optomechanical product lineWorking with the design responsible scientists, engineers, & quality personnel to maintain smooth design process and product function/reliabilityVisit Acuva’s vendors locally or overseas to setup, improve and verify proper production practices are followed (must be able to travel internationally)Additional duties as required to assist with joining techniques for mechanical devicesSkilled in mechanical part selection from off-the-shelf vendors (eg. We are seeking a skilled General Machinist to join our client's team in Brampton, ON location.Shift - DayResponsibilitiesSet up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision parts according to engineering drawings and specifications. Utilize manual and computer-controlled machinery, such as lathes, milling machines, drill presses, and grinders, to perform machining operations. Measure and inspect machined parts using precision measuring instruments, ensuring compliance with dimensional tolerances and quality standards. Interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, and work instructions to determine machining processes, tooling requirements, and sequence of operations. Select appropriate cutting tools, speeds, and feeds for each machining operation, optimizing efficiency and ensuring the quality of finished parts. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to machine setup, tooling, and machining processes to maintain productivity and quality standards. Perform routine maintenance tasks on machinery, such as cleaning, lubricating, and replacing worn components, to ensure optimal performance and longevity. Adhere to safety protocols and practices to minimize workplace hazards and promote a safe working environment. Collaborate with engineering, production, and quality assurance teams to optimize manufacturing processes and resolve technical challenges. Continuously strive to improve machining techniques, processes, and efficiencies through innovation and continuous learning. QualificationsMinimum of a high school diploma and Ontario Machinist Certification. At least 5 years of experience in machine shop and fabrication, particularly in producing thermoforming molds or similar applications. Proficiency in various tooling machinery usage, including Milling Machines, Lathes, Drilling Machine, Band saws, Grinders, etc. Ability to verify dimensions of machined parts or tooling using different measuring instruments such as Vernier Calipers, Micrometers, Height gauges, etc. Strong ability to read and interpret blueprints or examine sample parts to determine machining operations required.
